Class Effect

  • java.lang.Object
    • ontology.effects.Effect
  • Direct Known Subclasses:

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public abstract void execute(VGDLSprite sprite1,
                             VGDLSprite sprite2,
                             Game game)
        Executes the effect
        Parameters:
        sprite1 - first sprite of the collision
        sprite2 - second sprite of the collision
        game - reference to the game object with the current state.

      • executeBatch

        public int executeBatch(VGDLSprite sprite1,
                        java.util.ArrayList<VGDLSprite> sprite2list,
                        Game game)
        Executes the effect to all second sprites at once.
        Parameters:
        sprite1 - first sprite of the collision
        sprite2list - list of all second sprites of the collision
        game - reference to the game object with the current state.
        Returns:
        the number of sprites considered in the collision

      • sortBatch

        public int sortBatch(VGDLSprite sprite1,
                     java.util.ArrayList<VGDLSprite> sprite2list,
                     Game game)
        Takes a batch of sprites to collide against at once, and builds the collision boundary with them.
        Parameters:
        sprite1 - Sprite that collides with the batch
        sprite2list - Sprites to collide against.
        game - our game.
        Returns:
        number of sprites in the list to collide with. List comes back sorted by proximity.

      • determineCollision

        protected boolean[] determineCollision(VGDLSprite sprite1,
                                       java.awt.Rectangle s2rect,
                                       Game g)
        Determines if the collision is horizontal and/or vertical
        Parameters:
        sprite1 - Sprite colliding
        s2rect - Collision colliding against.
        g - game
        Returns:
        An array indicating if the collision is []{horizontal, vertical}.
